work_history.title: Software Quality Assurance Analyst
responsibilities: Conducted comprehensive backend testing for APIs and cloud functions to ensure functionality and reliability.
Performed front-end testing for clinical web-based diagnostic tools and messaging applications, improving usability and accuracy.

Collaborated as an active member of a cross-functional Scrum team, participating in all phases of the SDLC, including quarterly and sprint planning, design, development, validation, deployment, and process improvements.
Designed, tracked, and executed manual tests, ensuring the delivery of high-quality software.
Developed and maintained test documentation and artifacts such as test plans, suites, and cases using Azure DevOps, ensuring traceability of requirements and alignment with project goals.

Utilized diverse testing methodologies (e.g., branch and white box testing, black box, exploratory, and database testing) to ensure comprehensive coverage and identify critical defects early in the development process.
Performed component testing for cloud function applications and cloud storage queues to ensure seamless integration.
Executed thorough API testing, contributing to consistent data flow and system interoperability.

work_history.title: Software QA Engineer
responsibilities: Planned, developed, and executed manual and automated functionality and smoke tests using tools like Postman and Swagger, and performed on-the-fly release validation testing to support development and release management cycles.
Researched and tested tooling options for performance and load testing as part of an early DevOps initiative to improve system scalability.
Consistently identified and reported critical application bugs pre-release, leveraging the Atlassian suite to triage and monitor tests and issues effectively.
Mentored team members on technical tools and company-specific processes, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement.

work_history.title: Software Test Engineer
responsibilities: Played a critical role in establishing and scaling the testing framework for a small but rapidly growing provider of immunization tracking services.
Planned, developed, and maintained a robust suite of 800+ automated UI tests using C#, Selenium, and SpecFlow, significantly improving test coverage.
Collaborated closely with the development team to understand testing requirements, identify edge cases, and align testing capabilities with product needs.
Analyzed test results to identify trends and optimize test planning, contributing to improved product quality and reduced defect rates.
Provided technical mentorship and support to the manual testing team, including the creation of test data and guidance on testing methodologies.

work_history.title: Manager, Corporate Compliance
responsibilities: Provided compliance and regulatory support for enterprise clinical IT and billing systems.
Guided development, deployment, training, and leadership teams to ensure compliance with internal policies and external regulations.
Directed clinical, IT, revenue operations, and other stakeholders on compliance-related issues impacting clinical and billing systems.
Managed efforts resulting from audits of enterprise systems, ensuring timely resolution of findings.
Investigated and reported to leadership on compliance matters related to clinical and billing systems.

responsibilities.role: Administrator of Integrated Clinical/Billing EMR/EHR System
tasks: Configured and maintained user-facing and back-end components for clinical, billing, registration, and scheduling.
Served as the primary support resource for a 20-MD nephrology practice (~80 users across five outpatient locations).
Reported and provided guidance to partners and leadership on system issues and defects.
Researched and developed workflow solutions to meet clinical, billing, operational, and leadership needs.
Coordinated the management of clinical/billing interfaces with vendors and stakeholders, including bi-directional lab interfaces, claims processing, and Meaningful Use reporting.
Ensured uptime and functionality during system upgrades and IT outages.
Developed and deployed privacy and security training content and a comprehensive deployment plan.
Provided guidance on privacy and security considerations, ensuring compliance with HIPAA and security best practices.
Oversaw privacy and security aspects of clinical IT workflows, clinical research efforts, and vendor coordination.

responsibilities.role: Business Intelligence System Manager/Admin and Data Analyst
tasks: Delivered monthly, quarterly, and annual financial and operational reports to partners and leadership with a focus on accuracy and timeliness.
Researched and implemented methods for advanced clinical and financial ad hoc reporting using existing resources.
Developed workflows for efficient delivery of data and reports to leadership, providers, and clinical end-users.
Supported the establishment of and advised the practice’s clinical quality reporting committee.

responsibilities.role: Co-Manager of IT Resources and Processes
tasks: Advised leadership on purchasing decisions and coordinated with managed IT services vendors to address daily and long-term technology needs.
Led a successful campaign to improve mobile device security, advocating for better compliance with HIPAA standards and convincing leadership to adopt a Mobile Device Management (MDM) service.
Researched and deployed the MDM service, ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory requirements (e.g., CERT).
Administered and managed the company’s SharePoint system (2007), including extensive testing for migration to Office 365.

work_history.title: EMR/EHR System Consultant, Trainer, and Support Specialist
responsibilities: Supported clinical and administrative users, as well as project and client leadership, during EMR/EHR implementations and deployments.
Coordinated and delivered classroom-style training sessions for diverse clinical users, including specialist physicians (MDs), pharmacists, nurses (RNs), and others.
Provided on-site training to clinical and non-clinical users during and post-implementation, ensuring effective system adoption.
Developed training materials and resources tailored for clinical users to facilitate successful pre-deployment readiness.
Advised project coordinators on consultant deployment strategies and implementation considerations.
Delivered technical guidance to training teams, clinical management, and leadership based on client-specific needs.

work_history.title: Data Management Consultant in Program Evaluation
responsibilities: Analyzed and structured legacy data to support the cleanup and migration of a grant management and tracking system.
Identified problems and patterns to support migration of document-based and legacy data sources to ensure accuracy and usability.
Advised the Vice President of Evaluation on IT and information management needs, identifying risks, gaps, and opportunities for improvement.

work_history.title: Research Project Manager in Workforce Development
responsibilities: Led a regional survey-based research project to assess biotech workforce needs in the area.
Designed and deployed iPad-based questionnaires, ensuring technical feasibility and academic rigor.
Researched, tested, and selected vendors for field data collection technology to streamline survey efforts.
Recruited, hired, and trained a 6–10 member field team for data collection.
Managed the project’s budget, timeline, and execution, achieving budgetary compliance despite timeline challenges.
Conducted statistical analysis and summarized findings to deliver actionable insights to stakeholders.

work_history.title: Field Team Lead
work_history.company: National Center for Disaster Preparedness/Columbia University School of Public Health
responsibilities: Supervised a 5–10 person field team conducting data collection for a longitudinal study on the health impacts of Hurricane Katrina and regional healthcare needs.
Ensured data completeness and accuracy through quality reviews and daily operational oversight.
Coordinated with community organizations to locate and engage hard-to-reach respondents, contributing to high year-over-year participation rates.
Provided logistical and technical support to the field team, troubleshooting challenges to maintain project momentum.

work_history.title: Teacher, Language Arts
responsibilities: Instructed 6th and 8th grade English, focusing on language arts education.
Provided computer enrichment instruction to integrate technology into student learning.

work_history.title: Copy Editor, Page Designer
responsibilities: Managed content and page design for local and national news sections.
Oversaw Health content for the weekly Health section and quarterly health supplements.
Developed the publication’s first weekly opinion/insights section.

work_history.title: Copy Editor, Page Designer
responsibilities: Edited content and designed pages across various newspaper sections.

work_history.title: News Reporter
responsibilities: Reported on local news and sports, covering community events and developments.
